abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Agricultural Extension Project (PVA).
            The main objective of the Agricultural Extension Project
            (Projet de vulgarisationagricole, PVA) was to support over a
            four-year period, Government's program for improving
            agricultural extension services executed through Regional
            Directorates of Rural Development with a long-term objective
            of establishing a unified national service.  Bank's
            performance was deficient. Borrower's performance was
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            there has to be a conservative assessment of the
            Government's ability to meet its financial obligations
            under the project and the Bank has to be more responsive to
            increasing its share of financing operating costs; (ii)
            project management responsibilities must be clearly defined
            and detailed from the onset of the project to facilitate
            working relationships and coordination between units; (iii)
            implementation of technology disseminaton processes cannot
            be done in isolation of availability of farm inputs, market
            demand and accessibility, and producer credit; (iv) although
            the Borrower has the ultimate responsibility for the
            selection of TA staff, "no objection" to the
            selection should only be given after a thorough review of
            qualifications, experience and skills; (v) staffing of Bank
            supervision missions should give importance to
            continuity;and (vi) an extension system must respond to
            local environmental, technical and socioeconomic conditions
            and evolve accordingly.
